This review is for the new location in the Westfield Topanga Plaza mall. I don't frequent mall restaurants but my husband got a CPK gift card for his birthday so we decided to brave the crowds and give this place a try. I had not eaten at a CPK in years and was very surprised at the decor and the menu of this very pretty pizza kitchen! We sat on the indoor patio and started out with some cold Chardonnay on this stifling hot night in Canoga Park. We shared delicious spinach artichoke dip which was enough for four and served with tortilla chips. I had the lettuce wraps with chicken and shrimp. Fresh shiitake mushrooms, water chestnuts, and scallions were tossed in a spicy ginger soy sauce served with peanut dipping sauce on the side! Yum! We also had the grilled chicken Caesar sandwich with shaved Parmesan, lettuce, and tomatoes. We ordered off the "secret" menu too since we were with old pros who knew this trick. The tricolore pizza is a holdover from early CPK days and had field greens, chicken, shaved Parmesan and crispy crust. For dessert try the butter cake with Haagen -Dazs vanilla ice cream! Pretty good! We all liked it!

This is a hard review for me to write. I am not a fan of CPK. I only eat there because its my sisters favorite place to eat and she does not get out much. I would never go of my own volition. I have to say yesterday was very hard going to CPK when I had to walk right by my all time favorite place that has now moved into the Westfield Mall- The Cheesecake Factory............. I have been going to CPK for at least 13 years now.  I find their menu selection pretty limited.  (Yes the word Pizza is in their name so it should come as no surprise). As usual this location is several STEPS UP from the Tarzana Location (inadvertently listed on Yelp as Encino).  The employees here are almost always really friendly and nice. The managers always come by at some point to check.  They do always want to make things right and I appreciate their customer service. I was very pleased when ordering my meal that at this location they are able to accommodate- whereas the Tarzana location they tell me to go pound sand.  We were forced to go to the Tarzana location while this CPK moved into their new place in Westfield.  I had in fact not ordered any food my last several visits. It was with great trepidation that I ordered and I was so pleased that they did not even blink an eye with my request for my crust to be done lightly.  I find if it gets browned it has the texture of a stale dog biscuit and even with my good teeth I find I would rather eat my dogs milk bones then their crust. I have not been able to say this for a long time about CPK but yesterday my food was perfect.  YAY Again I have never had an issue with their employees- they are great- and yesterday was no different. My only complaint is this.  In this location they have changed how their bathrooms were set up.  There is a door that leads to the toilets.  Ok no problem.  You finish in the bathroom and SURPRISE THERE IS NO SINK IN THE TOILET AREA. WHAT?   There are also no paper towels.  That means that you have to TOUCH A DOOR HANDLE TO GET OUT TO THE SINK AREA.  I can not even begin to conceive the amount of E-Coli and who knows what else that is on that door handle.  I presume to save money and space they thought it was a good idea to have one sink area to service the mens and ladies rooms and the employees.  I am honestly shocked that the Health Department was ok with this set up. My gross out factor was HIGH.  I did not feel like I could get my hands clean enough after touching that door.  I will definitely take Clorox Wipes in with me the next time.  Cheesecake Factory will still tug at my heart and stomach as I go by there in a few months but at least I will not be dreading my visit to CPK as I had for the last several months while they renovated and we were stuck going to the Tarzana store.

Full menu is available out there. I like the new decor, which is more rustic yet clean & modern and the restaurant is very open structurally to the mall.  They have a dispenser of lemonade or some drink out front which is nice to have available while you're waiting.  They have a lot of hostesses working at the front with iPads and they seemed fairly organized.  We were seated within 5 minutes. Menu seems to be pretty much the same standard Cpk.  I did notice a chalkboard sign promoting a secret menu (not very secretive though) so I tried the garlic chicken pizza.  It was really good.  The waitress said I was the 2nd person to order it... This review is for the new location in the Westfield Topanga Plaza mall. I don't frequent mall restaurants but my husband got a CPK gift card for his birthday so we decided to brave the crowds and give this place a try. I had not eaten at a CPK in years and was very surprised at the decor and the menu of this very pretty pizza kitchen! We sat on the indoor patio and started out with some cold Chardonnay on this stifling hot night in Canoga Park. We shared delicious spinach artichoke dip which was enough for four and served with tortilla chips. I had the lettuce wraps with chicken and shrimp. Fresh shiitake mushrooms, water chestnuts, and scallions were tossed in a spicy ginger soy sauce served with peanut dipping sauce on the side! Yum! We also had the grilled chicken Caesar sandwich with shaved Parmesan, lettuce, and tomatoes. We ordered off the "secret" menu too since we were with old pros who knew this trick. The tricolore pizza is a holdover from early CPK days and had field greens, chicken, shaved Parmesan and crispy crust. For dessert try the butter cake with Haagen -Dazs vanilla ice cream! Pretty good! We all liked it!

This is a hard review for me to write. I am not a fan of CPK. I only eat there because its my sisters favorite place to eat and she does not get out much. I would never go of my own volition. I have to say yesterday was very hard going to CPK when I had to walk right by my all time favorite place that has now moved into the Westfield Mall- The Cheesecake Factory............. I have been going to CPK for at least 13 years now.  I find their menu selection pretty limited.  (Yes the word Pizza is in their name so it should come as no surprise). As usual this location is several STEPS UP from the Tarzana Location (inadvertently listed on Yelp as Encino).  The employees here are almost always really friendly and nice. The managers always come by at some point to check.  They do always want to make things right and I appreciate their customer service. I was very pleased when ordering my meal that at this location they are able to accommodate- whereas the Tarzana location they tell me to go pound sand.  We were forced to go to the Tarzana location while this CPK moved into their new place in Westfield.  I had in fact not ordered any food my last several visits. It was with great trepidation that I ordered and I was so pleased that they did not even blink an eye with my request for my crust to be done lightly.  I find if it gets browned it has the texture of a stale dog biscuit and even with my good teeth I find I would rather eat my dogs milk bones then their crust. I have not been able to say this for a long time about CPK but yesterday my food was perfect.  YAY Again I have never had an issue with their employees- they are great- and yesterday was no different. My only complaint is this.  In this location they have changed how their bathrooms were set up.  There is a door that leads to the toilets.  Ok no problem.  You finish in the bathroom and SURPRISE THERE IS NO SINK IN THE TOILET AREA. WHAT?   There are also no paper towels.  That means that you have to TOUCH A DOOR HANDLE TO GET OUT TO THE SINK AREA.  I can not even begin to conceive the amount of E-Coli and who knows what else that is on that door handle.  I presume to save money and space they thought it was a good idea to have one sink area to service the mens and ladies rooms and the employees.  I am honestly shocked that the Health Department was ok with this set up. My gross out factor was HIGH.  I did not feel like I could get my hands clean enough after touching that door.  I will definitely take Clorox Wipes in with me the next time.  Cheesecake Factory will still tug at my heart and stomach as I go by there in a few months but at least I will not be dreading my visit to CPK as I had for the last several months while they renovated and we were stuck going to the Tarzana store.

I have been going to CPK for over 10 years now. Ever since I was in middle school. This has always been one of my favorite places to eat of all time. I've been going to this particular one for as long as I can remember but it used to be located where the new Cheesecake Factory now is. I liked that location better because it was on the outside of the mall so you didnt have to walk thru the entire mall if you wanted to just eat at CPK.  The new one is completely different than the old. New style more up to date. The last few times I have been to CPK they really havent been the same.  If I had to guess I would think that they changed their recipes. I asked them and they said no but maybe the cooks were just having off days.  My absolute favorites from CPK are the spinach and artichoke dip, BBQ pizza and the chicken Caesar sandwich. My mom loves this place so we decided to give it another shot. I ordered the BBQ chicken pizza and she ordered the garlic fettuccine with chicken and mushrooms.  We also ordered the spinach and artichoke dip.  The dip was good. Not AMAZING like it used to be. I used to think it was the best on earth. I still do but it isnt like how it used to be at all. The BBQ chicken pizza was better this time than I ordered it last. I can't complain.  My mom's pasta was good also. Not as garlicky as you would think since it has garlic in the name. Not very heavy and creamy like a standard fettuccine. We ordered a chicken caesar sandwich to go also. They got rid of the foccacia bread which is really disappointing. The new bread isnt bad but the old was much better.  The service was good. We sat in the part where the bar is in the middle of the mall.  They have an inside dining and an outside part that is situated directly in the middle of the mall in between the stores. I don't really care that they have that there but they do have a full bar and tvs so if you're in the mall and just want to grab a drink and watch a game its good for the fellas.  Overall its alright.  Im loosing my CPK cravings as time goes by. This place isnt fine dining but used to be really tasty for what it is. I will be going back but not on my top 5 to recommend.

The food was OK, service was good but the price was ridiculous. I don't mind spending when I go out, I just hate it when I have to pay for a rip off. The price I paid for 2 glasses of wine, an appetizer, one salad and one pasta was just ridiculous. We did not even finish the pasta because it was not even that good. The salad was an OK salad, I could probably make better salad. So if you really want to get ripped off while getting exceptional service, this is the place for you. I actually left this place hungry so we had to go to the restaurant that we initially planned on going to.

review: I'm trying to like it as I used to come here A LOT!! (Or at least the one in studio city) aaand I'm here again today because I'm with family and was voted out. The new concept is nice (I guess they are trying to be more upscale); however, the changes with the menu and the prices are not cool. I mean why get rid of the delicious focaccia bread for the sandwiches?! Don't fix something that's not broken!! So...not only did they change that, they upped the prices of the sandwiches by $2!! Oh and the bread they now give you at the table is laughable!!! What is this tiny baguette sliced up into 4 pieces (we had a table of 4)?! I'm not exaggerating! The slice is not much bigger than a half dollar coin!!  Now our waitress was very nice and she knew her stuff so this review is based only on the new concept of CPK!  A little change or upgrade isn't bad, but to rid of or change the favorites isn't cool. Oh and I noticed that It's almost not a place to take little kids because it's more trendy and bar like.  Go see for yourself or not!!!

Our experience here today was alright. Nothing fabulous, but not bad. Service: our waitress was nice. She was pleasant and attentive.  Ambience: this CPK has recently been moved to a new location inside the mall and is completely re-styled from how it was before. It was a little more modern, a little less "screaming kids running around". Which would've been great if there hadn't been a screaming child next to us. Le sigh... Food: my mom and I both ordered the Italian chopped salad. Hers came with tomatoes and basil and mine didn't, which I kind of don't get since these identical salads could've been mixed in the same bowl. We both also asked for extra garbanzo beans, but there were very few in either salad. I know these "problems" could've easily been rectified, but we were in sort of a rush and (without telling our waitress that fact) our food had come quickly (which we very much appreciated). My salad wasn't bad, but it wasn't correct.  I used to LOVE CPK. I used to come a few times a month with my friends and I always ordered the spicy Thai chicken pasta. Well, that item was removed from the menu years ago and with all the other changes, CPK lost its sparkle for me. I may come back if it is convenient.

And when the drinks came the root beer was too watery. It took a while to get the waitresses attention, and when we complained about this, the waitress said that she noticed that the root beer looked light. But she had never bothered to ask us about it.  The week before we got a take-out order from this location, and when we got home we realized that they had forgotten to put in the sauces for the lettuce wrap. Today we were shopping in the mall and placed a take out order. According to our receipt, we paid for the to go order at 4:32, and we were told the order would be ready in 20 minutes. The meal did not become available until 5:23. More than 50 minutes later. As I say, I'm a regular customer at CPK. I go there because I expect very good service and I usually get it. unfortunately that does not seem true lately, of this location.

They did a great job with the decor and prime location which is now in a central area of the mall. I love that there is a separate bar area located "outside" of the restaurant. And by "outside" I mean that it's located directly across from the restaurant in the middle of the mall. So it's like you are outside but still inside. You get a view of the rest of the shops and the passerbys without having to deal with the weather. The food itself is a little revamped. They seemed to have cut out some things and added more small plates and healthier items. I am so happy they finally changed their bread. They used to give cold bread with butter and now they finally give you warm bread with a nice olive oil with herbs dip. Nice touch to step it up a little. Service was good and overall food was great. I will be coming back and maybe I'll sit in the bar area next time!

I have been going to CPK for over 10 years now. Ever since I was in middle school. This has always been one of my favorite places to eat of all time. I've been going to this particular one for as long as I can remember but it used to be located where the new Cheesecake Factory now is. I liked that location better because it was on the outside of the mall so you didnt have to walk thru the entire mall if you wanted to just eat at CPK.  The new one is completely different than the old. New style more up to date. The last few times I have been to CPK they really havent been the same.  If I had to guess I would think that they changed their recipes. I asked them and they said no but maybe the cooks were just having off days.  My absolute favorites from CPK are the spinach and artichoke dip, BBQ pizza and the chicken Caesar sandwich. My mom loves this place so we decided to give it another shot. I ordered the BBQ chicken pizza and she ordered the garlic fettuccine with chicken and mushrooms.  We also ordered the spinach and artichoke dip.  The dip was good. Not AMAZING like it used to be. I used to think it was the best on earth. I still do but it isnt like how it used to be at all. The BBQ chicken pizza was better this time than I ordered it last. I can't complain.  My mom's pasta was good also. Not as garlicky as you would think since it has garlic in the name. Not very heavy and creamy like a standard fettuccine. We ordered a chicken caesar sandwich to go also. They got rid of the foccacia bread which is really disappointing. The new bread isnt bad but the old was much better.  The service was good. We sat in the part where the bar is in the middle of the mall.  They have an inside dining and an outside part that is situated directly in the middle of the mall in between the stores. I don't really care that they have that there but they do have a full bar and tvs so if you're in the mall and just want to grab a drink and watch a game its good for the fellas.  Overall its alright.  Im loosing my CPK cravings as time goes by. This place isnt fine dining but used to be really tasty for what it is. I will be going back but not on my top 5 to recommend.

Went to CPK for lunch today, sat in the bar area (with a friend). I must say we had the worse service EVER! The waiter took FOREVER to take our drink order and then when he finally took our drink order... He took FOREVER TO GET OUR DRINKS TO US!  Then when we were ready to order our food out waiter then never came back around to our table, we had someone else take our food order, and we NEVER had been asked how we where doing, if we needed anything else.  My friend asked for a refill on  her drink she never received it. Finally got a third waiters attention and he got the drink for her.  Not the best service.

So I came here with my mom and sister who had her 3 month old baby and 3.5 year old son.  Things didnt go so well so far as the staff went but I'm actually not even gonna talk about that because I think everyone can have an off day.  What I am gonna say is that the new location in the mall is fantastic.  It's nice and open and even has outdoor seating in the middle of the mall.  The food is always good, that's a given.  Because things were really not going so well I had to ask for the manager.  We were greeted by the general manager, Joseph Polimeni.  He listened to everything I had to say, he never interrupted, he never tried to make an excuse, he asked all the proper questions so that he would be able to speak with his staff and establish exactly where things went wrong and how to correct them. He apologized.  He picked up the tab and was adamant that my mom, who never received her salad had one made to go.  When she said it was OK because she she would be walking through the mall, Joseph made it a point to tell her to just come by and pick it up when she was done shopping so she could bring it home with her.  We've all been to restaurants and had poor service or just had everything go wrong.  We've all had the manager come over and try to sweep it under the rug or offer a token dessert.  I could not have been more impressed by how Mr. Polimeni handled this.  If you read my reviews I tend to focus on the exceptional service and places I've been rather than slamming places for where they fail.  The reason for that is that I believe one bad experience doesn't represent a place that is clearly not a 1 star restaurant.  CPK is a mainstay in Southern California; we'll be back and back again and I just wanted to point out what good will and customer service is all about.  If only more managers learned the proper way to handle things when they go south.  Thank you!

Friday night, LA Kings vs N.Y. Rangers 2nd OT, after shopping my boyfriend and I decided to grab a beer and watch the Kings possibly win the Stanley Cup. We always walk by CPK with their open faced bar in the heart of the mall. We figured we might as well sit in and finish the game. We see a vacant tall table in the corner of the bar area with half empty waters as if customers just left. We asked a star gazed employee to confirm if the table was vacant. She said she wasn't sure but she could check and send a someone to bus the table. We sat at the table while she went to grab someone, we began to watch the 2nd OT. Time passed, no acknowledgement, no busser. I have looked her dead in the eye as she walked toward the bar to watch the game, I'm sure she saw me. Again, no follow up, no acknowledgement.  We sat there doing part of what we planned on doing and thats to finish the game. Im glad we didn't give them our business by buying beers or this would've took a turn in content.  Being people of principle, after the game, we wanted to let the restaurant manager know what didn't happen. The guy in charge comes out, tries to bribe us to stay for dinner. After being at this establishment unacknowledged for almost 30 minutes, why the hell would we stay LONGER to eat for "free"? We're not looking for a free meal. Fix your customer service and your employees. There were 3 hostess at the front that said nothing to us walking in, and 3 more huddled around a cash register lollygagging. The hell? By the looks of the previous reviews, this place is messed up and need to be replaced with another establishment. The reviews before mine should tell you  a couple things: 1. This place is hit or miss. 2. nothing has changed and more than likely nothing will.

I'm not sure what the deal is with the service here at lunch on weekdays.  I've been here twice and both times our server just seemed to disappear for about 15 minutes in the middle of our meal.  Once it was before our food was delivered, and when it was finally delivered it was cold.  The last time was a couple of days ago and it took 20 minutes to get our check after we were done eating, I literally had to take the kids and leave my wife there to find the check because we were all getting stir-crazy! The food (when you get it hot) is what you'd expect from CPK.   This location can get a little noisy.  If you're in a hurry, skip it.

Where to start... where to start... I've gone here several times now and I guess i'm just glutton for punishment... Let me start with my most recent experience starting with the service. Appetizers and entree's came out at the same time even though we staggered our order. In fact we got bread for the table at the same time as everything else as well. So I came here with my mom and sister who had her 3 month old baby and 3.5 year old son.  Things didnt go so well so far as the staff went but I'm actually not even gonna talk about that because I think everyone can have an off day.  What I am gonna say is that the new location in the mall is fantastic.  It's nice and open and even has outdoor seating in the middle of the mall.  The food is always good, that's a given.  Because things were really not going so well I had to ask for the manager.  We were greeted by the general manager, Joseph Polimeni.  He listened to everything I had to say, he never interrupted, he never tried to make an excuse, he asked all the proper questions so that he would be able to speak with his staff and establish exactly where things went wrong and how to correct them. He apologized.  He picked up the tab and was adamant that my mom, who never received her salad had one made to go.  When she said it was OK because she she would be walking through the mall, Joseph made it a point to tell her to just come by and pick it up when she was done shopping so she could bring it home with her.  We've all been to restaurants and had poor service or just had everything go wrong.  We've all had the manager come over and try to sweep it under the rug or offer a token dessert.  I could not have been more impressed by how Mr. Polimeni handled this.  If you read my reviews I tend to focus on the exceptional service and places I've been rather than slamming places for where they fail.  The reason for that is that I believe one bad experience doesn't represent a place that is clearly not a 1 star restaurant.  CPK is a mainstay in Southern California; we'll be back and back again and I just wanted to point out what good will and customer service is all about.  If only more managers learned the proper way to handle things when they go south.  Thank you!

I have dined at this location numerous times and to be quite honest it continues to be a hit and miss type of establishment. Unfortunately, tonight was one of their "off" nights in my opinion. The service was extremely slow, our waitress was no where to be found several times, and the quality of the food was not to their usual standard. After placing our order our waitress had us waiting around 15 mins before even serving the complimentary bread and water. Majority of the time CPK establishments are pretty quick with service and the food is usually spot on, however when it's an "off" night for this location, as was tonight, the food was mediocre. The salad I ordered had about one drop of dressing, which surprised me because I usually need to order dressing on the side to avoid there being too much. As I continue to say most visits here are quite good and I would recommend trying it if you find yourself strolling through Topanga Mall, although be sure to be very specific with what you would like to eat and I have noticed that the quality of service is directly related to the time of day. For some reason they tend to provide better service and food quality during the busiest hours of the day (4pm-7:30pm). After this the staff tends to slack a bit as they showed quite clearly tonight.

Ever since I was a little girl I've loved CPK.  My favorite is the Original  BBQ Chicken Pizza.  Over the years they've had some yummy new dishes and appetizers.  This CPK used to be one of my favorites when it was in its original location in the mall.  Ever since it moved to the center of the mall, it hasn't been up to pare.  I've ate here on several occassions and have ordered take-out, and I'm truly disappointed with the quality of their food.  Just last week Friday, I placed an order for take-out and got the Kung Pao Spaghetti, Original BBQ Chicken Salad, spinach artichoke dip and a kids BBQ chicken pizza.  The spaghetti and pizza had no complaints from the people who ate it, but they did complain about the dip .   The Original BBQ Chicken Salad not to pleasant at all. First off the chicken was so soft and mooshy and then parts of it felt like plastic and you pay extra just because of the chicken.  That killed my salad for me.  Here's the worst part in my ranch dressing there was a hair! Ewww totally grossed me out as well! The Spinach Artichoke Dip is usually on point but this time it was just a disaster.  let's not mention how my stomach felt afterwards. We came here for early dinner last night and everything I had was really good.  Here's what I had: Glass of Chardonnay:  Good and stored well.  But this was the only problem-- it was not chilled enough. Appetizer:  Tuscan Hummus - Delicious! Main Course:  Asparagus and Spinach Spaghettini - Delicious, delicious! Dessert:  Butter Cake topped with Haagen Daaz Vanilla Ice Cream - Delicious, delicious, delicious!  I'm a chocolate-cake person so it was not my idea to order this.  But another, wow, I would never have thought that a butter cake could taste delicious, much less VERY delicious.  In addition, the restaurant's set-up was quite cool.  They have an island-bar in front (basically on the mall's "hallway") with bar tables.  And both the island-bar and the restaurant have a cool trendy look.  The service was good too.   Forget Joe's and all those over-rated restaurants!

Hadn't been to the new CPK location since it moved from the southwest corner and came inside "The Canyon," the skylit area within the central Westfield Topanga mall. Always walked by the lounge area and everyone seemed happy drinking diverse cocktails and eating individual pizzas. They revamped their logo and the menu is really diverse -- they need to get the word "pizza" out of there because there's so much more -- salads, soups, sandwiches, pastas and appetizers. Brought our toddler and infant to this location and look forward to returning. Service was excellent and accommodating. Every request was met and several suggestions were offered to make our potentially nightmarish lunch really relaxing and enjoyable. We enjoyed two beers on tap which were well needed. They also had two of my favorite beers on tap -- 805 and Stella Artois. The menu is diverse and everything looks healthy and/or delicious. We went with the quinoa salad and split the chipotle pizza. Both were excellent. My toddler had a cheese pizza which she devoured and she hasn't been eating as much as she should be. Everything down to the pre-meal French bread and olive oil was outstanding. We were seated in the back of the restaurant and weren't even distracted by the busy kitchen. It took until the end of the meal for me to look over -- kids kept me occupied. The only oddity is the bathrooms share a sink area outside. I suppose it's helpful and they at least have paper towels by the door ... since you can't wash your hands until you're outside. There are a few dozen items on the menu I could try so hope to soon.

We got the Chinese chicken salad and were not given serving spoons to serve it, or plates as we had informed them that we'd be sharing it. Additionally, I had kindly asked them to put channel 2 on for the UCLA game and they did, but not long after they changed it to a different game and I was very annoyed as I had not left. Super yummy food.  I love the bread here, it's so soft and fresh and chewy.   Today I had the 7-inch lunch size California Veggie Pizza and cup of Dakota Smashed Pea + Barley soup.  I was a bit hesitant about getting pea green soup...  but it was delish!   The barley was perfectly cooked and soft and tender.  The pizza had tons of veggies and the crust was so thick and chewy.  Sooo good!!   I tried to get a "healthier" option from the lunch menu by going vegetarian today, but it's still quite caloric.  With the bread and butter and olive oil dip, my meal came out to almost 1000 calories.  :O  But totally worth it for a special treat out.  I just ate a light dinner tonight to compensate.  ;)

CPK is CPK; it's nothing outstanding, nor terrible. The food is generally okay, and their pizza isn't anything super amazing. But, whenever I come to enjoy a drink at the ~outdoor~ bar, I'm always met with a pleasant attitude from the bartenders who never fail to make sure that even a simple drink is a positive experience.  I do appreciate the new remodel, because it allows for some excellent people watching as you enjoy your drinks; you pretty much have a view right in the middle of the mall, so it never gets boring. The bartenders are prompt in greeting you, even if they're busy, as well as making your drinks and closing you out. They never seem bored or stand around, and even as they converse with you (which they're great at sensing when it's time to disengage), the staff is always working.  Their selection of beer isn't anything super fabulous and their cocktails are pretty good; I do recommend the sangrias, though they veer on the edge of being sweet. Their old fashioneds are no good though, since they do muddle the orange and cherries, which is pretty much standard at any chain restaurant. I wouldn't really recommend making this a destination, though they ambience within is nice, but more of a pit-stop if you're shopping or mosey-ing around.

My 23rd birthday fell the day after Mother's Day this year so my mom and I spent our Sunday (this May 8th) joint-celebrating. Even in LA with countless options for unique and fantastic cuisine, we opted for CPK. Why? Because we love it!! All I wanted was a meal I knew I could rely on, good unobtrusive service, and a mojito. But what I wanted most of all, was a lovely afternoon out with my mom. I worked as a sever for several years and understand what sets a great sever aside very well. Maybe too well. I would never give a server a hard time for attempting to develop a relationship with their tables or allowing their personality to show. However. There is a line that can be crossed and unfortunately it was. From the moment we were situated in the restaurant, our server piled on the up-selling SO much my mom and I practically felt we weren't allowed to order what we actually wanted. My mom ordered the cheapest glass of white wine. Instead of taking her order, our server so aggressively started selling her a different wine that she felt forced to say "ok..." I'll note that our server never mentioned the price of this wine. Also never mentioned that there were different pour options with different prices (6oz or 9oz, he took the liberty of assuming she'd opt for the 9oz). Now let me reiterate. I've done my time in the service industry. I know the importance of up-selling and I even know the feeling of a (really, really BAD) manager breathing down your neck to do so (a good manager never would). But it's completely inappropriate to mislead, misinform, or berate a customer in order to do so. And doing so with a smile on your face does not negate the fact that you are indeed doing so!! That glass of wine? TWICE the price of the original glass she ordered. Yeah, usually when people order the cheapest glass of house white, they did that on purpose. Next he finally asks for my drink order. Without pause I politely ordered a mojito, only to be nearly interrupted with more up-selling. This time for a completely different cocktail that I did not want. After way too long arguing back and forth, he finally accepted that I would be having a mojito and not what he wanted me to have. He checks our IDs and leaves. 5-8 minutes later (on the late-end of the time our drinks should have been arriving) our sever comes back and points to me: "so... Your birthday is tomorrow, not today?" I respond yes. To be completely honest, I was getting ready to hear "happy early birthday, drink is on us!" Nope. He proceeded to go on and on about how they absolutely cannot serve me until the day of my actual birthday------?!?!?!!!!???? "you realize I am turning 23 tomorrow, not 21." He then argues with me!!! He claims that he read the date "May 9, 1993" and even asked his manager (his MANAGER?!!!) and they both agreed that if I was born 5/9/1993 I was underage. I had to sit there explaining elementary math to this person when I should have been enjoying a private lunch with my mom. He then FINALLY agrees to go "check the math again" (wow..) and when he returned (obviously proven wrong) he just blamed the discrepancy on the manager. Nice. Clearly the whole flow of our lunch together was ruined at this point. And there were plenty of other frustrating nuances, trust me. Our appetizer was served long after our meals had arrived, our salmon was grossly overcooked, and of course there was some more invasive up-selling of their newest dessert.  I understand that Mother's Day is one of the busiest holidays for restaurants but we were one of the first people to arrive when they opened.  This was hands down one of the worst experiences I've ever had at a restaurant in general, and it happened at one of my all time favorites. So disappointed, shocked, and hesitant to ever return.

I appreciate the new fangled idea of putting restaurants in actual malls. While food courts, nowadays, have stepped up their game there are times I'd like to just sit down and thoroughly enjoy my meal in an actual restaurant with nice decor and good food without having to leave the mall. With that being said, I've been pleasantly surprised at the quality of food at CPK. It's only been this past year that I've noticed how often my sister and I have eaten here by choice and convenience.  Our usual order consists of the following for both of us to share.... -Qunoa & Arugula Salad: a super-grain salad with asparagus, sun-dried tomatoes, red onions, toasted pine nuts and Feta tossed in their housemade Champagne vinaigrette. You get your choice protein (chicken, shrimp, or salmon) for an additional charge. However the salad is good as is. We don't order any protein. Everything about this salad is perfect. I love the peppery arugula, the slight pop-in-your-mouth quinoa, the chewy sun-dried tomatoes, the sharp red onion, the nutty pine nuts, and salty feta. This is easily my 2nd favorite salad (my absolute favorite salad is the Nicoise salad from Los Olivos Cafe--see my review). This salad is so effing good! -Roasted Artichoke & Spinach Pizza: a pizza with oven-roasted artichoke hearts, roasted garlic, sautéed spinach, Mozzarella and Parmesan. You can opt to include chicken, but the pizza is good as is. We don't include any chicken. This is hands down my favorite pizza at CPK. The flatbread pizza is the perfect vehicle for the combination of yummy ingredients. There is no pizza sauce, which I like since all the flavor is basically coming from the roast garlic, mozzerella, and parmesan. This pizza is so effing good! These dishes are fantastically delicious to the point where I find myself craving them.  ***My most recent dining experience at CPK was earlier today, with my sister lol***  I'm currently doing Whole30 (if you don't know what Whole30 is, it's basically a cleans but definitely google it for more information). Since I was unable to order the usual above items, I settled on the... -Roasted Garlic Chicken & Seasonal Vegetables: Pan-sautéed chicken breast in lemon-garlic sauce with hearth-roasted fingerling potatoes, cauliflower, Mediterranean herbs and seasonal vegetables. I was bummed that I could't order the Salad or the Pizza and I honestly didn't have high expectations about this Chicken dish. However when it was finally brought to our table, I was mind blown.  The chicken was juicy and well seasoned. The fingerling potatoes were crips on the outside but soft and mealy on the inside. The seasonal vegetables consisted of colored carrots, beets, and cauliflower all with a slight bite to them instead of being overcooked and mushy. It was basically this dish that made me want to write a Yelp review on just how good of a job CPK seems to be doing with their food.  I am aware that CPK is a chain and chains aren't well known for offering delicious food, but CPK is an exception. I'm already craving their Quinoa & Arugula Salad and their Roasted Artichoke & Spinach Pizza!!!

I like to post reviews so people can get a good feel for how the experience went. I'm not into trash talking or putting down an establishment because everyone needs to make money but with this experience from beginning to end, they did earn the 1 star they received. My boyfriend and I went to CPK on Saturday around 11am. They did not have a lot of customers to begin with as it was kind of early still, and we were seated in a booth near the kitchen. Our waitress who failed to give us her name, brought us our drinks and then said she would bring us some bread. 20 minutes later (no exaggeration) she finally brought the bread and took our orders. I got the Thai chicken pizza and my boyfriend got the garlic creame fettucinne with chicken and shrimp. When we received our dishes I have to say my pizza was awful. I honestly don't know how this was listed in the menu as a "favorite" but to give you an idea, there were 2 small pieces of chicken per slice, a ton of peanut sauce and peanuts, and then a bunch of raw carrots, bean sprouts and scallions. I've seen people order this particular pizza before and the vegetables on top were not as raw as they were on our pizza. Needless to say, this pizza is a huge thumbs down. And! The crust? It was super chewy and not pleasant to eat. The pasta by far surpassed the pizza though as being the worst out of the two. The pasta was not even cooked "al dente;" it was really gummy to chew through and got stuck in my molars! Instead of having them just do away with all of the dishes because I dislike being the person sending food back, but you simply can't eat half cooked pasta it isn't pasta, I went ahead and had the manager come over. During this whole situation unfolding, our waitress came over right after the food was delivered to ask how it was and we had not had a chance to try it as of then but our glasses were empty; no offer for a refill so I requested one from a different waitress as we couldn't find her. The manager came over, and we told her of the situation she gladly offered a different dish but we just agreed to go ahead and stick with the pizza we had (we shared it halfheartedly) and they removed the pasta from the bill. I've eaten at a ton of California Pizza Kitchen's but our waitress, or lack thereof made the experience not worth it and if Gordon Ramsay was running that kitchen the plated pasta would have never left the kitchen as you could see with your eyes alone the pasta wasn't finished cooking.

I got the Thai chicken pizza and my boyfriend got the garlic creame fettucinne with chicken and shrimp. When we received our dishes I have to say my pizza was awful. I honestly don't know how this was listed in the menu as a "favorite" but to give you an idea, there were 2 small pieces of chicken per slice, a ton of peanut sauce and peanuts, and then a bunch of raw carrots, bean sprouts and scallions. I've seen people order this particular pizza before and the vegetables on top were not as raw as they were on our pizza. Needless to say, this pizza is a huge thumbs down. And! The crust? It was super chewy and not pleasant to eat. The pasta by far surpassed the pizza though as being the worst out of the two. The pasta was not even cooked "al dente;" it was really gummy to chew through and got stuck in my molars! Instead of having them just do away with all of the dishes because I dislike being the person sending food back, but you simply can't eat half cooked pasta it isn't pasta, I went ahead and had the manager come over. During this whole situation unfolding, our waitress came over right after the food was delivered to ask how it was and we had not had a chance to try it as of then but our glasses were empty; no offer for a refill so I requested one from a different waitress as we couldn't find her. The manager came over, and we told her of the situation she gladly offered a different dish but we just agreed to go ahead and stick with the pizza we had (we shared it halfheartedly) and they removed the pasta from the bill. I've eaten at a ton of California Pizza Kitchen's but our waitress, or lack thereof made the experience not worth it and if Gordon Ramsay was running that kitchen the plated pasta would have never left the kitchen as you could see with your eyes alone the pasta wasn't finished cooking.
I only come here specifically for the tequila lime chicken pasta. Last order I got here, there was hardly any chicken. I mean you would be pretty irritated too if you spent $15 on just noodles.

My 23rd birthday fell the day after Mother's Day this year so my mom and I spent our Sunday (this May 8th) joint-celebrating. Even in LA with countless options for unique and fantastic cuisine, we opted for CPK. Why? Because we love it!! All I wanted was a meal I knew I could rely on, good unobtrusive service, and a mojito. But what I wanted most of all, was a lovely afternoon out with my mom. I worked as a sever for several years and understand what sets a great sever aside very well. Maybe too well. I would never give a server a hard time for attempting to develop a relationship with their tables or allowing their personality to show. However. There is a line that can be crossed and unfortunately it was. From the moment we were situated in the restaurant, our server piled on the up-selling SO much my mom and I practically felt we weren't allowed to order what we actually wanted. My mom ordered the cheapest glass of white wine. Instead of taking her order, our server so aggressively started selling her a different wine that she felt forced to say "ok..." I'll note that our server never mentioned the price of this wine. Also never mentioned that there were different pour options with different prices (6oz or 9oz, he took the liberty of assuming she'd opt for the 9oz). Now let me reiterate. I've done my time in the service industry. I know the importance of up-selling and I even know the feeling of a (really, really BAD) manager breathing down your neck to do so (a good manager never would). But it's completely inappropriate to mislead, misinform, or berate a customer in order to do so. And doing so with a smile on your face does not negate the fact that you are indeed doing so!! That glass of wine? TWICE the price of the original glass she ordered. Yeah, usually when people order the cheapest glass of house white, they did that on purpose. Next he finally asks for my drink order. Without pause I politely ordered a mojito, only to be nearly interrupted with more up-selling. This time for a completely different cocktail that I did not want. After way too long arguing back and forth, he finally accepted that I would be having a mojito and not what he wanted me to have. He checks our IDs and leaves. 5-8 minutes later (on the late-end of the time our drinks should have been arriving) our sever comes back and points to me: "so... Your birthday is tomorrow, not today?" I respond yes. To be completely honest, I was getting ready to hear "happy early birthday, drink is on us!" Nope. He proceeded to go on and on about how they absolutely cannot serve me until the day of my actual birthday------?!?!?!!!!???? "you realize I am turning 23 tomorrow, not 21." He then argues with me!!! He claims that he read the date "May 9, 1993" and even asked his manager (his MANAGER?!!!) and they both agreed that if I was born 5/9/1993 I was underage. I had to sit there explaining elementary math to this person when I should have been enjoying a private lunch with my mom. He then FINALLY agrees to go "check the math again" (wow..) and when he returned (obviously proven wrong) he just blamed the discrepancy on the manager. Nice. Clearly the whole flow of our lunch together was ruined at this point. And there were plenty of other frustrating nuances, trust me. Our appetizer was served long after our meals had arrived, our salmon was grossly overcooked, and of course there was some more invasive up-selling of their newest dessert.  I understand that Mother's Day is one of the busiest holidays for restaurants but we were one of the first people to arrive when they opened.  This was hands down one of the worst experiences I've ever had at a restaurant in general, and it happened at one of my all time favorites. So disappointed, shocked, and hesitant to ever return.

I personally enjoy the indoor seating area that's in the middle of the mall versus the seating inside the actual restaurant. It's more open, has natural light from the sky lights above and doesn't feel as compact.  The pizza at CPK is made with fresh and tasty ingredients...Whether you are getting the plain ol' Cheese and Pepperoni, the classic BBQ Chicken Pizza or one of my favorites, the Thai Chicken Pizza, CPK has it figured out. Whether being served at a table or from behind the to-go counter, the staff is always friendly and helpful. This CPK even offers a curbside pickup in which they will deliver to your car at a designated area in the Owensmouth parking structure. Complimentary bread and oil was brought to the table and our sever was very attentive during the course of our meal.  My recommendations for your next visit:  -White corn guacamole and chips -The Original Chopped Salad (with garbanzo beans) -Thai Chicken Pizza -Kung Pao Spaghetti pasta Enjoy!

This CPK is located inside the Westfield Topanga Mall in Canoga Park. Can't complain about the food - it's pretty much up-to-snuff with their other locations. Two things I knock off stars for are the service and restroom situation. The restaurant has an "outside"/bar area in the middle of the mall and a regular inside area. It doesn't really matter where you sit because the service is dependably bad either way. Servers disappear for long periods of time and when you finally spot yours, trying to catch their attention is like trying to catch smoke! The restaurant is rarely full anyways so it's bewildering what portal they keep on escaping to. The restrooms don't have sinks inside the actual restrooms. Instead there's a large communal sink outside both doors which is just plain gross. The food is always good but getting it to go is your best bet. And good luck with the mall parking because it can get a little sporty!

Our friends had two meals and a soup for their kid and bill was $92 big ones. These days, that's not bad for a party of 4.  They were super busy as we were there around 1:45 , so service was a little slow,,but our waitress did a good job. We enjoy hanging out with this couple as we can burp and fart without any concern nor judgment. I did hear a neighboring party gossip about the "indescribable odor" but it's all good as I am used to getting attention.  We will be back soon, if we go to the mall again.

Not like Donald Trump is running the country issues, but management issues that extend far beyond host duties. This boils down to not having enough staff to accommodate customers appropriately, as well as understanding the general flow of customer wants/needs.   You would think a large chain such as CPK would have figured this out by now. Nope. When we told the hostess we weren't going to wait to be seated she looked at us like she had never heard that before. Why would we wait when the place is half empty and there are numerous other places in the mall to eat?!?  I get it, mall life is crazy, but the general rules of common sense apply: if there are seats, seat your customers immediately. It's not rocket science, folks.

Food was good; service was okay.  But boo-hiss on the computation of suggested gratuity. It's only a few extra dollars to me, but overall it is in your favor entirely and, if intentional, which it appears to be since it is stated on the receipt, a despicable practice in my opinion... please compute correctly: subtotal times gratuity percentage equals suggested gratuity. It is not typical to compute gratuity on the total, tax included, like you are doing... EVER. State sales tax is a collection of funds by the state government and not the goods/services that are being acknowledged/rewarded/compensated with a tip. Disclosure does not make a bad business practice good! In the end, it's my own fault.  I should be better at mental math but after a cocktail or two I just can't do it so I trusted you. Never again... I'll pull out the calculator no matter how much that might make me look like a cheap, tightwad, imbecile.

First time going to this location of CPK in the mall and I have to say that I was very satisfied with the experience which included the food, vibe, color scheme, and staff. Got to say though, the vibe you feel in this place is so nice and color scheme will make you feel so relaxed. I think it just makes you buy more food cause that's what we did. For an appetizer, I just got the Chicken Dumplings and the sauce is delicious. I got the BBQ pizza and it was okay.  The waiter we had seated us friendly and always checked on us like for a good amount of time to make sure everything was alright. She brought the food in a swift manner and it was like so perfectly timed too because after I finished my appetizer, it would be like 10 minutes later for the main course to come. Pretty cool. Hope to come back soon though.
